source.utils package

Submodules

source.utils.enum module

File containg all the aws enumeration function used to get data.

source.utils.enum.ec2_lookup()[source]

Return all ec2 instances.

Returns:

elements – List of the existing ec2 instances

Return type:

list

source.utils.enum.list_traffic_policies_lookup(function)[source]

Get all the results of the list_traffic_policies command of the route53 client.

Parameters:

function (str) – Concatenation of the client and the command

Returns:

elements – List of the results of the command

Return type:

list

source.utils.enum.misc_lookup(client, function, name_token, array, **kwargs)[source]

Do the same as the previous function, but we can then filter the results on a specific part of the response. Used by functions not usable by paginate.

Parameters:

  • client (str) – Name of the client (S3, LAMBDA, etc) only used for the progress bar

  • function (str) – Concatenation of the client and the command (CLIENT.COMMAND)

  • name_token (str) – Name of the token used by the command to get the other pages of results.

  • array (str) – Filter added to get a specific part of the results

  • **kwargs (list, optional) – List of parameters to add to the command.

Returns:

elements – List of the results of the command

Return type:

list

source.utils.enum.paginate(client, command, array, **kwargs)[source]

Do the same as the previous function, but we can then filter the results on a specific part of the response.

Parameters:

  • client (str) – Name of the client used to call the request (S3, LAMBDA, etc)

  • command (str) – Command executed

  • array (str) – Filter added to get a specific part of the results

  • **kwargs (list, optional) – List of parameters to add to the command.

Returns:

elements – List of the results of the command

Return type:

list

Returns:

elements – List of the existing buckets

Return type:

list

source.utils.enum.simple_misc_lookup(client, function, name_token, **kwargs)[source]

Return all the results of the command, no matter the number of results. Used by functions not usable by paginate.

Parameters:

  • client (str) – Name of the client (S3, LAMBDA, etc) only used for the progress bar

  • function (str) – Concatenation of the client and the command (CLIENT.COMMAND)

  • name_token (str) – Name of the token used by the command to get the other pages of results.

  • **kwargs (list, optional) – List of parameters to add to the command.

Returns:

elements – List of the results of the command

Return type:

list

source.utils.enum.simple_paginate(client, command, **kwargs)[source]

Return all the results of the command, no matter the number of results.

Parameters:

  • client (str) – Name of the client used to call the request (S3, LAMBDA, etc)

  • command (str) – Command executed

  • **kwargs (list, optional) – List of parameters to add to the command.

Returns:

elements – List of the results of the command

Return type:

list

source.utils.utils module

File containing all types of functions and variables, used everywhere in the tool.

source.utils.utils.POSSIBLE_STEPS = ['1', '2', '3', '4']

-1 means we didn’t enter in the enumerate function associated 0 means we ran the associated function but the service wasn’t available

source.utils.utils.athena_query(region, query, bucket)[source]

Run an athena query and verifies it worked.

region: str

Region where the query is made

querystr

Query to be run

bucketstr

bucket where the results are written

Returns:

response – Results of the response

Return type:

dict

source.utils.utils.copy_or_write_s3(key, value, dst_bucket, region)[source]

Depending on the action content of value (0 or 1), write the data to our s3 bucket, or copy the data to the source bucket to our bucket.

Parameters:

  • key (str) – Name of the service

  • value (dict) – Either logs of the service or the buckets where the logs are stored, based on the const LOGS_RESULTS

  • dst_bucket (str) – Bucket where to put the data

  • region (str) – Region where the serice is scanned

source.utils.utils.copy_s3_bucket(src_bucket, dst_bucket, service, region, prefix='')[source]

Copy the content at a specific path of a s3 bucket to another.

Parameters:

  • src_bucket (str) – Bucket where all the logs of the corresponding service are stored

  • dst_bucket (str) – Bucket used in incident response

  • service (str) – Service of which the logs are copied (s3, ec2, etc)

  • region (str) – Region where the service is scanned

  • prefix (str, optional) – Path of the data to copy to reduce the amount of data

source.utils.utils.create_command(command, output)[source]

Merge the command and its results.

Parameters:

  • command (str) – Command made

  • output (dict) – Output of the command

Returns:

command_output – Command and its results

Return type:

dict

source.utils.utils.create_folder(path)[source]

Create a folder.

Parameters:

path (str) – Path of the folder to be created

source.utils.utils.create_s3_if_not_exists(region, bucket_name)[source]

Create a s3 bucket if needed during the investigation.

Parameters:

  • region (str) – Region where to create the s3

  • bucket_name (str) – Name of the new bucket

Returns:

  • bucket_name (str) – Name of the newly created bucket

  • Note that for region=us-east-1, AWS necessitates that you leave LocationConstraint blank

  • https (//docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/API_CreateBucket.html#API_CreateBucket_RequestBody)

source.utils.utils.create_tmp_bucket(region, bucket_name)[source]

Create a tmp bucket (only when the local flag is present for the logs analysis).

Parameters:

  • region (str) – Name of the region where the analysis is done

  • bucket_name – Name of the tmp bucket

  • region=us-east-1 (Note that for) –

  • blank (AWS necessitates that you leave LocationConstraint) –

  • https (//docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/API_CreateBucket.html#API_CreateBucket_RequestBody) –

source.utils.utils.get_table(ddl, get_db)[source]

Get the table name out of a ddl file.

Parameters:

  • ddl (str) – Ddl file

  • get_db (bool) – False if you only want the table name. True if you also want the db name that can be present just before the table name.

Returns:

  • table (str) – Name of the table

  • data (str) – Content of the ddl file

source.utils.utils.is_dict(data_dict)[source]

data_dict (dict) – Dictionary to verify

source.utils.utils.rename_file_s3(bucket, folder, new_key, old_key)[source]

Rename a s3 file (well it copies it, changes the name, then deletes the old one).

Parameters:

  • bucket (str) – Bucket where the file to rename is

  • folder (str) – Folder where the file to rename is

  • new_key (str) – New name of the file

  • old_key (str) – Old name of the file

source.utils.utils.run_s3_dl(bucket, path, prefix='')[source]

Handle the steps of the content’s download of a s3 bucket.

Parameters:

  • bucket (str) – Bucket being copied

  • path (str) – Local path where to paste the content of the bucket

  • prefix (str, optional) – Specific folder in the bucket to download

Parameters:

region (str) – Region where the client will be used

  • mode (str) – Opening mode of the file (w, a, etc)

  • content (str) – Content to be written in the file

source.utils.utils.write_or_dl(key, value, conf)[source]

Depending on the action content of value (0 or 1), write the data to a single json file, or download the content of a s3 bucket.

Parameters:

  • key (str) – Name of the service

  • value (str) – Either logs of the service or the buckets where the logs are stored, based on the const LOGS_RESULTS

  • conf (str) – Path to write the results

source.utils.utils.write_s3(bucket, key, content)[source]

Write content to s3 bucket.

Parameters:

  • bucket (str) – Name of the bucket in which we put data

  • key (str) – Path in the bucket

  • content (str) – Data to be put

Returns:

response – Results of the request made

Return type:

dict

Write a local file to a s3 bucket.

Parameters:

  • bucket (str) – Bucket in which the file is uploaded

  • key (str) – Path where the file is uploaded

  • filename (str) – File to be uploaded

Returns:

response – Response of the request made
